content.description:
Question refers to the following image.

© Magdalena Abakanowicz, Courtesy Marlborough Gallery, New York / Image © The Metropolitan Museum of Art / Image Source © Art Resource, NY
content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The work shown is Androgyne III, created by Magdalena Abakanowicz in 1985 C.E.

Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work.

Using at least two examples of specific visual evidence, explain how the work references and/or departs from the classical Western tradition of depicting the human body.

Using specific evidence, explain why the artist chose to depart from the classical Western tradition of depicting the human body in this work.

topic.text: 10.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
